plain: The user's favourite genre is likely to be fiction, as all of the books listed are works of fiction. The user's favourite length is likely to be one that is not too long, as all of the books listed are relatively short in comparison to other works of fiction. The user's favourite topic is likely to be one that deals with coming-of-age, as "The Catcher in the Rye" is a classic coming-of-age story. The user's favourite pacing is likely to be one that is steady and consistent, as all of the books listed are known for their well-paced narratives. The user's favourite narrative structure is likely to be one that is third-person omniscient, as all of the books listed are written in this style. The user's favourite themes are likely to be ones that deal with social commentary, as both "Animal Farm" and "The God of Small Things" deal with social issues.
